div.p: The Yost Theater is a Historic Landmark in Santa Ana and is the oldest theater in Orange County. The Yost first opened its doors in 1913 when it was known as The Auditorium. In the same year, it was renamed The Clunes. It was not until Ed Yost purchased the theater in 1919 that the name was changed again. Today, it still holds the same name, The Yost Theater. In the 1950s, the Golden Age of Mexican Cinema was at its peak. Taking the era in consideration, Luis Olivos Jr, the owner at the time, brought the talents of Mexican cinema to The Yost, which included Antonio Aguilar and Vicente Fern√°ndez. Later in the 1970s, Olivos booked celebrities such as Ike and Tina Turner, as well as Sonny and Cher. After years of neglect in the 1990s and 2000s, in 2007 the Los Angeles Times reported that the Yost Theater would be reopened and serve as a benefit to the community of Santa Ana (Los Angeles Times).
